target_markets.market_description: Business owners and entrepreneurs seeking to scale their businesses
pain_points: wanting to switch to 'more scalable' business models
target_markets.market_size_indicators: 78% of businesses in the United States are service-based businesses

problems_validated.problem: Business owners abandoning viable businesses because they believe they aren't scalable
problems_validated.severity: Described as 'one of the most insidious beliefs' that 'ends the most businesses'
problems_validated.current_solutions: Switching to different business models or abandoning current businesses
problems_validated.market_gap: Lack of understanding that all businesses have scaling challenges and the solution is persistence through difficult periods

products_tools.name: acquisitioners.com
products_tools.metrics: thousands of businesses have come to their headquarters

business_strategies.strategy: Understanding business constraints and solving through promotion
business_strategies.implementation: Identify if you're demand-constrained or supply-constrained, then use promotion to solve either problem
business_strategies.expected_results: Ability to scale through constraint periods

business_strategies.strategy: Persistence through scaling difficulties rather than switching business models
business_strategies.implementation: Recognize that scaling problems take quarters to solve, not weeks, and maintain course during difficult periods
business_strategies.expected_results: Successful scaling without abandoning viable business models
business_strategies.case_study: Supply-constrained business hiring process taking 6 months to show results

problems_solutions.solution: Promotional cycle to attract and hire qualified staff
problems_solutions.time_estimate: 3-6 months for new hires to become proficient

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Abandoning a viable business because you think it's not scalable
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Losing a potentially profitable business and starting over unnecessarily
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Understand that all businesses have scaling challenges and focus on solving constraints rather than switching models
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Service business owners switching to other service businesses expecting different scaling characteristics

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Changing business model during the waiting period while solving scaling problems
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Never allowing solutions to take effect and constantly restarting
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Recognize that scaling solutions take months, not days, and maintain course during difficult periods
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Entrepreneurs who change their model during the 6-month period while waiting for new hires to become proficient

growth_tactics.tactic: Use promotion to solve both supply and demand constraints
growth_tactics.results_expected: Resolution of business constraints over quarters

trends_signals.trend: Service-based business dominance in US economy
trends_signals.opportunity: Focus on scaling service businesses rather than avoiding them

actionable_quotes.quote: 78% of businesses in the United States are service-based businesses
actionable_quotes.context: Explaining why avoiding service businesses is unrealistic
actionable_quotes.actionability: Focus on scaling service businesses rather than avoiding them

actionable_quotes.quote: My business isn't scalable means it's hard and I want it to be easy
actionable_quotes.context: Explaining the real meaning behind scalability concerns
actionable_quotes.actionability: Accept that scaling is difficult and focus on persistence rather than easy alternatives

actionable_quotes.quote: Difficulty is a feature, not a bug, of scaling a business
actionable_quotes.context: Reframing the expectation around business scaling
actionable_quotes.actionability: Embrace difficulty as part of the scaling process rather than avoiding it

key_statistics.statistic: 78% of businesses in the United States are service-based businesses
key_statistics.context: Used to demonstrate that service businesses are the norm, not the exception
